AppSettings.title: Application Settings
AppSettings.description: Stores global application settings for integrations and e-commerce.

id.description: Unique identifier for the settings document.

spreadsheetUrl.description: The URL of the Google Sheet used for data storage.

credentials.description: The credentials used to access the Google Sheet (e.g., JSON key).

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp of the last update to these settings.

currency.description: The currency symbol for invoices, e.g., USD.

taxRate.description: The tax rate in percentage, e.g., 10 for 10%.

packagingCharge.description: A flat packaging charge added to each invoice.

serviceCharge.description: A flat service or handling charge added to each invoice.

discount.description: A flat discount amount applied to the entire invoice.

id.description: The user-friendly unique identifier for the invoice.

tokenId.description: A daily-resetting sequential token number for the invoice.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created the invoice.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the invoice was created.

definition.description: Stores global application settings. This collection should only contain a single document with a known ID (e.g., 'global').

params.name: settingId
params.description: The unique identifier for the settings document, typically 'global'.

firestore.reasoning:
This project follows the best practice of using separate, top-level collections for each data model. This ensures that the data for products, invoices, and settings are managed independently for better security and scalability.

1.  **/products/{productId}**: Stores the product catalog. In this prototype, any authenticated user can manage products. For production, this access should be restricted.

2.  **/invoices/{invoiceId}**: Stores individual invoice documents. Security rules ensure users can only access their own invoices.

3.  **/settings/{settingId}**: Stores global application settings in a single document. Access should be restricted to admin users in production.
